column4: anyone here familiar with nomachine nx? i want to know how/if i can simply resume the original gnome session instead of creating one when i connect through nx
on a related issue: is there any cli or gui method to monitor user sessions?
monitor in what way? Just typing "who" will tell you who's logged in
i've used that before, but i'm a little confused by the results
it shows 3 user sessions:
that's ony real tty (console login - probably the main login shell) and two virtual terminal sessions (probably gnome-terminal or similar)
*one real
all of those sessions belong to the same user, who appears to be called "user" on your system
i guess the stem of my question is i want to ensure there arent mult. gnome sessions running and bogging down my machine
since nx creates one and there's already the default one running locally
oh... hm
you'd need to pipe "ps -aux" into grep and search for the right thing, I think
ps -aux | grep gnome-session might do what you want
I *think* two running copies of gnome will require two running copies of gnome-session, but not sure
one minute
http://paste.ubuntu.com/462169/
two gnome-sessions, thus two running gnomes.
right. i guess that's good enough
